name: signal-desktop-mcp
description: Access your Signal Desktop messages through AI assistants
long_description: This MCP server enables AI agents and tools to access Signal Desktop chat messages via the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It supports listing chats, retrieving messages with pagination, and searching within conversations. Signal Desktop must be closed when using this server. All data remains local - nothing is sent externally.

source_dir.title: Signal Data Directory
source_dir.description: Path to Signal Desktop data directory. Leave empty to use the default location for your OS (macOS: ~/Library/Application Support/Signal, Windows: %APPDATA%/Signal, Linux: ~/.config/Signal).

key.title: Encryption Key
key.description: Signal database encryption key. On macOS this is automatically retrieved from the Keychain. Only needed if automatic detection fails.

tools.name: signal_list_chats
tools.description: List all Signal chats with their details including contact names, numbers, and message counts

tools.name: signal_get_chat_messages
tools.description: Retrieve messages from a specific Signal chat by contact name with pagination support

tools.name: signal_search_chat
tools.description: Search for specific text within a Signal chat's messages

prompts.name: signal_summarize_chat_prompt
prompts.description: Generate a summary prompt for recent messages in a specific chat
prompts.text: Summarize the recent messages in the Signal chat named '${arguments.chat_name}'.

prompts.name: signal_chat_topic_prompt
prompts.description: Generate a prompt to analyze discussion topics in a chat
prompts.text: What are the topics of discussion in the Signal chat named '${arguments.chat_name}'?

prompts.name: signal_chat_sentiment_prompt
prompts.description: Generate a prompt to analyze message sentiment in a chat
prompts.text: Analyze the sentiment of messages in the Signal chat named '${arguments.chat_name}'.

prompts.name: signal_search_chat_prompt
prompts.description: Generate a search prompt for finding specific text in a chat
prompts.text: Search for the text '${arguments.query}' in the Signal chat named '${arguments.chat_name}'.
